Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on April 30, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 – 6992.

Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information

prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (g) If the employee has criminal
convictions, the institution shall complete
a written evaluation of the convictions that
addresses the nature of the conviction,
the length of time since the conviction,
and the relationship of the conviction to
regulated activity for the purpose of
determining suitability for employment in
the institution.
One file reviewed was lacking a written evaluation by the employee addressing
their criminal convictions.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The facility had seven special investigations during this period under review with
two resulting in corrective action plans. The facility’s corrective action plan
compliance is monitored quarterly, and they have completed all current corrective
action plans.
The facility’s interim inspection last year resulted in three rule violations. The
violations addressed lacking employee performance evaluations, missing an initial
health screening for a youth, and not having documentation of current
immunizations for youths. These citations were corrected.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the annual
financial audit report.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reported the facility had a difficult group of young ladies
for a period of time at the houses. The Chief Administrator stated she sees a
sense of hopelessness in the youth at time because of a lack of post placement
options. The Chief Administrator stated at times it feels they are the only one
advocating for the kids and working to find the youths' next placement.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling supported by management and having a clear understanding
of rules, policies, and procedures. Staff stated they feel youth are getting what they
need while at the facility, but youth get stagnate and the length of stay ends up
being longer than necessary.
Youth reported in interviews feeling safe, getting their needs met and going on
outings. One youth reported feeling staff really care about her and help her when
she is struggling with her mental health.

Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of both houses occurred on April 3, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
